article.headline: Samford 55, Elon 31
article.story: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. -- Josh Davis scored 12 points and Bryan Friday added 11 points, leading Samford to a 55-31 win over Elon in the Southern Conference opener for both teams on Thursday night. Davis hit four 3 pointers for the Bulldogs (2-5), who finished 10-for-21 from beyond the arc (47.6 percent). The Phoenix (2-6) shot just 3-for-25 from 3-point range (12 percent). Samford jumped out to a 13-4 lead to open the game and never looked back. Jeffrey Merritt scored five of his seven points during the spree, connecting on a layup and a 3-pointer. The Bulldogs led by 14 points at the half and increased their lead to 39-16 early in the second frame. Josh Bonney led the Phoenix with nine points. Samford shot 50 percent (21-for-42) from the floor compared to just a 26 percent mark (13-for-50) for Elon. The Bulldogs outscored Elon in the paint 18-8.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
